data.title: Expand Proximity/CellTriggers with an onOwnerChanged method.

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
If an actor changes ownership while under the active effect of a
proximity trigger affecting the two players differently, the trigger
misses out to update the actor in the moment of the owner-change
reflecting that and will try to revoke the new owner's states when the
actor later leaves the trigger while leaving the old owner's state
there.

This can crash the game if one of these proximity triggers is an
UpgradeActorsNear, which is supposed to only grant upgrades to the new
owner - it misses granting them but later tries to properly revoke them.

Credits to lucassss for figuring out the underlying issue.

Fixes #11707.

data.title: RA bots build medics and mechanics, which they don't know how to use
data.body:
```
17:13 < Maddness> Also noncombatant units sit around when their squad attacks something, I would like them to follow the other units instead.
17:14 <+pchote> the AI shouldn't be building noncombatant units
17:14 <+pchote> for that reason
17:15 <+pchote> the current AI framework is fundamentally incapable of doing anything that relies of specific units
17:17 < Maddness> Noncombatant as in medics and such.
```

Looks like they were introduced in #11807.

Reported by Frame_Limiter via IRC:
If you rearm your hinds using the shortcut key "F", the hinds will stack on top of one another and remain on the helipad.

data.title: [Lobby] Limit the amount of spectators / "Lock" current spectators
data.body:
It would be really handy for events like tournaments but also in general to - from a certain point on - be able to "lock the specs". Keeping the specs that are already in, and at the same time, prevent further ones from joining.

This will especially come in handy if there are tournament matches afoot, where of course you want some specs (casters/officials), albeit only those and not more.

one of them. Eliminates OpenRA/ra2#291.

data.title: nod07a: crash because script tries to kill camera

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
when reaching the bridge on the left side of the map, the Nod base is discovered
this triggers a flare at the Nod base, and creates a camera which shows the base

when reaching the Nod base from the left (not from the south!), reinforcements are triggered
this triggers a timer which kills the flare and the camera after a delay (2 minutes)
when the timer runs out, the mission crashes since cameras can't be killed:

```
Fatal Lua Error: [string "BindingSupport.lua"]:30: Actor 'camera' does not define a property 'Kill'
```

to reproduce more easily: 
in line 217 in nod07a.lua (Trigger.AfterDelay(DateTime.Minutes(2), function()) change "Minutes(2)" to "Seconds(2)", then just send the light tank to the area to the left of the Nod base to trigger the reinforcements

data.title: Clean up GPS code.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
This takes a few small steps towards making the GPS code comprehensible, and then fixes #11955.

The intentional logic changes are:
- Map explore now runs at most once per player, triggered the first time that they or one of their allies' GPSWatcher becomes enabled (previously it would happen every time any player enabled or disabled their gps dots by enabling or disabling a radar or tech center)
- GpsPower → GPSWatcher updates may be delayed by a tick on capture or building, in exchange for not getting horribly out of sync when capturing while having/not having a radar dome.
- Frozen actor preview removals no longer requires you _and_ an ally to have an active GPS to run (pretty sure this was an unreported bug)
- Activating a GPS will now only refresh your allies' state, not all players.  If this code were sensible this would have no impact on the game, but this code is not sensible.  Beware while testing.

I strongly recommend reviewing commit-by-commit to follow the changes.
